[]Author: Lessley Ann;
Rating: 5
When: 9 months ago
We took advantage of fabulous postcorona offer. And for the price we got more than expected. A modern room and breakfast in an outstanding panoramatic rooftop restaurant with huge glass windows. Internet worked well. Nothing to complain about.

Author: Chacha Durazo;
Rating: 2
When: 9 months ago
Our AC doesn't work. The room is incredibly dated and questionably clean. Location is great but I will definitely look elsewhere in the future. They left our bags in the main lobby for several hours unattended even though we were promised they would put them in our room (we checked in early but as the room wasn't ready, we left our bags and returned in the evening several hours later). Carpet everywhere which is gross. Definitely not the 4 star they market themselves as.

Author: Marek Grabowski;
Rating: 1
When: 6 months ago
SCAM, BEWARE - THIEFS OPERATE IN THE HOTEL We were attacked by a thief inside the hotel in the morning while going for breakfast. He walked in freely to 3rd floor, and jumped on us in a narrow corridor, hitting me in the face and pushing down the stairs. Thankfully other guests came with help and he run away. The hotel didn‚Äôt care. The reception was empty once I went down (nobody checks who enters the hotel). Finally the receptionist appeared and said he didn‚Äôt see anything (well, not surprisingly) and that‚Äôs a normal thing. They didn‚Äôt even bother to check if the thief left the hotel or to notify the police. I left my number for a manager who didn‚Äôt bother to call me. I never felt such disregard for guests even in 1-star hotels. Unless this hotel cooperate with thiefs which would explain their approach. CHOOSE THIS HOTEL FOR YOUR OWN RISK.

If anybody is trying to find good deals for hotels visit RoomBully. com booked a hotel on there and they had the best rates anywhere! Great location and value for money.Hotel is a bit old but has been refurbished and the room was very good.Roof bar and the restaurant was great and the view eating breakfast was superb.

[]Author: Dr. Francesco Prato;
Rating: 5
When: 6 months ago
A reduced version of the original museum in Vinci (near Florence) but with all the most important inventions showcased. You can also try them out. Well done.

Author: Daniel Stiller;
Rating: 4
When: 8 months ago
It waa a nice and informativ visit, although the tour is a littlebit shorter then expected first. Bit the audio guides are kreativ and well made and the workers are very helpful. I can recommend it, espacially as a "free" addition to one of the city pass tourist tickets.

Author: Kyle Taylor;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Very friendly staff, some awesome gifts and items for the house or friends :)

Author: Paul R;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Really good value...nice place to escape the heat for a bit

Author: Dave Ruijer;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Fun and interactive museum about the great ideas and creations from Leonardo Da Vinci. We went late afternoon without a line stopping us to enter the museum quickly. By entrance you get a map of the museum with pictures of the objects on it. With a little scanner, headphone included, you can tab on the picture what is relevant at the moment you stand in front of an object. You will here a voice in your selected language explaining the background of the piece. Several mechanical creations can be tried. By doing this you get close in the genius mind of Leonardo Da Vinci and realize he went far in front of his era. Also for kids this is a very educative museum wich stimulates the mind. After the tour in the museum you can buy fun souvenirs like T-shirts, books, etc.

[]Author: Ghazzal Mehdi;
Rating: 5
When: 8 months ago
Surely a five star place. Perhaps the most iconic in Rome? To be honest, Rome has so many iconic places that I lost the count... Anyway, near to. Vetican, great bridges.. Simply outstanding...

Author: Marcos Chavarria;
Rating: 4
When: a month ago
Greater sight from the outside, I hope the pictures make sense of the very nice place this is. The architecture is different from other landmarks as it was intended for a different purpose in the religious history. Prepare to walk a lot. I would recommend the walking tour if possible.

Author: Marcel van Poeijer;
Rating: 4
When: 4 months ago
This huge Castle is definitely worth a visit. Even though I did not go in (entrance fee = 15EU), I still loved the outside area and the little park next to it. When you go inside, it is recommended to go before sunrise, as the sunrise view on top of the terrace should be lovely.

Author: Ken Saberi;
Rating: 4
When: 7 months ago
Great place to visit with spectacular views all around Rome. Interesting artefacts and some Papal history to see. Some of the rooms are stunning. There are a lot of stairs so people with mobility issues may struggle although there is a lift to the second level which can be used on request. This does mean that you will lose out on the top terrace which provides the best views. All the staff were extremely helpful and kind.

Author: Rich;
Rating: 3
When: 7 months ago
A fine visit. The best thing about this castle is the view you get once you're on the top floor.

[]Author: maxine lloyd;
Rating: 1
When: a year ago
We came from England to attend the museum which showed on the internet that it was open, we got a taxi and made our way to the door only to be told that it was closed!! Even though the door was clearly open!! Very disappointed by the ladies response to us. Update your page if you‚Äôre going to be closed!! Wasted journey would not recommend wasting your time or money clearly do not want your business as they were too busy talking on the doorstep!!!!!

Author: Raphael Aretakis;
Rating: 4
When: 5 years ago
We bumped into this museum while wandering the city. It was an amazing surprise for us. We ended up seeing things we would normally never see. If you like police novels and criminal stories, that is the place to be!!
